MOGADISHU, Somalia = Fight
ing was reported along the border
between Somalia and Ethiopia
where both countries have de-
clared a state of emergency.


The Somalian government said
1t had cabled its United Nations
representative to seek an imme-
date meeting of the US. Sc
curity Council to examine 1.-THE
extremely grave situation"

CLEVELAND. Ohio = Charges
aimed at ousting the Cleveland
School Board president, for slur-
ring remarks about Negro pupils
in a teleWsion interview recently
Is being prepared by the Legal
Redress Committee Of the local
branch Of the NAACP.


Clarence A. Holmes, an attor-
ney and president Of the Cleve-
land NAACP branch and Harold
Williams. branch executive sec
rotary, made the announcement
after the remarks of Ralph A.
McAllister, school board off,
cial,


McAllister said Negro pupils
in Cleveland could not be inte-
grated into classrooms with white
pupils because they were "edu-
cationally Inferior


CHOSE remarks" commented
Williams, "had the ring of those
persons filled with the philos-
ophy Of a super race"


Chester K. Gillespie, veteran
civil rights lawyer and mem
Der of the State School Board said
the school board chief could be
removed from office by the judges
of the Common Pleas bench un-
der a state law that gives them
that right.


Commenting further, Mr.. Gil
lespie said.


"McAllister, as president of
our school board, told the peo-
pie Of Cleveland that Negro pu-
pills in effect, were a bunch of
morons and would degrade any
class to which they were ad-
mitted. t


"That type Of talk resembles
that of Gov. Barnett Of Missis-
sippi or of Orval Faubus of
Arkansas and doesn't sound like
the utterance of an Individual
living in a northern, enlightened
community such as Cleveland"

Fresh for spring Is this silk
crepe polka dot by Michael Nov
arese of New York, with full
sleeves and blouson look this
dress will wear we'll at any
stylish event. is one of many de-
signer fashions to be featured in
the 36th annual Gel Desfile de
las Modas del Desierto' ira
ditional fashion show presented
by the YWCA and G oldwaters. The
show will be held poolside at the
Safari Hotel in Scottsdale on Feb
ruary is, Sat. at $3.50 pm.


All proceeds will be used for
building improvements at the
YWCA, 230 E. Earll Drive. Tic
kets are available at the WV, all
Goldwater stores and may be pur-
chased at the hotel the afternoon
of the show.

The Choraliers of First In
stitutional Baptist Church. ll4l
E. Jefferson, will present a con-
cert Sum-, Feb. Is at 7 pm.


1t will present compositions
Of the late R. Nathaniel Dett,
an internationally known Negro
pianist. ~


The program will observe Ma
rional Negro History Week.


Dett was the first Negro to re-
ceive the bachelor Of music de-
gree for original compositions
from Oberlin Conservatory. OBJ
erlin, Ohio. In 1926, he received
a doctor degree in music from
Oberlin College.


Some Of his we'll known works
are "Danse Juba" and "Listen
to the Lambs

Negro Hi.troy Week
Program Set At
First Baptist

When his bite starts to get to
you, tap him across the nose
with your finger and scold him,
saying, "No bitew several times.


He must learn not to go too
far in play, and that he can
never bite or growl at human
being. You'll be amazed at how
quickly he'll learn this if you
arrange behavior lessons so that
he gets one or two each day.


Caution: Don't overdo any
lesson - Is minutes is enough.

Temple Sholom's Sisterhood
presents its 1864 Modern Lit
erature Series. All meetings are
at 1000 am.


DR.. Gershon will review the
following books for us:


Tuesday, February l8 ) The
Battle of the Villa Fiorita by
Runner Golden.


Tuesday. February Is The
Negro Protest by James Bald
win, Malcolm, x, Martin Luth-
er King and Kenneth B. Clark.

SYDNEY, Australia World
welterweight champion Emile
Griffith of New York battered
Ralph Dupas of New Orleans into
submission winning a knockout
victory in the third round.


Dupas, nearly helpless under
Griffith s fists, fell from a crash
ing right to the jaw after two
minutes of the third round. He
had been floored three times In
the second and the crowd was
screaming to referee Vic Patrick
to stop the fight before the end
came.

MEXICO CITY A l0-year
old girl has given birth by cea-
sarean section to 5-pound, To-
ounce son at the Women s Hos
pital.

OF the Furlna


Dog Care Di-
vision, says
that to prevent
puppy from
biting too hard,
play with him


u ntil he be-
comes angry.

All puppies like to rough
house. However, puppies soon
bite too hard and their teeth are
very sharp. They also tend to be-
come over-excited and angry.


C. C. "Tex" Fawcett, Director
